discourse_list.title: Collateral Onboarding Call #42: Monetalis MIP65 & MIP68 AMA

content.content: Collateral Onboarding Call #42: Monetalis MIP65 & MIP68 AMA       Intro Monetalis Group is hosting an open community discussion on two self-contained, real-world collateral onboarding MIPs entering the next Governance cycle:  MIP65: Clydesdale - Liquid Bond Strategy & Execution MIP68: Lusitano  Join us as we host Allan Pedersen @Allan_Pedersen and Alessio Marinelli @wrongcomma to lead a discussion on the evolution of Monetalis’s strategy to onboard real-world assets by building a pathway for financial institutions and high-quality investment teams into DeFi.  Agenda    Intro by @juan & @retro  Presentation by Monetalis Group Community Q&A   Resources  [Forum Post] Monetalis Evolution   Our approach to DeFi/TradFi integration is to focus on scaling volumes fast using a solid integration point that requires limited changes to the day-to-day business of both TradFi/DeFi. We do believe the end-state is a thorough on-chain integration between TradFi and DeFi, but we do think it is day-to-day large volumes of capital interactions that will drive this on-chain integration at a very large scale - going from experimentation to mainstream with institutional asset managers. So first volumes, then growing on-chain integration. … Monetalis can be seem, logically, as divided into 3 interacting components: ARENA: The Off-chain/On-chain, TradFi/DeFi integration point (underlying in both MIP’s) CLYDESDALE: Integrating financial institutions with DeFi (MIP65) LUSITANO: Onboarding high-quality investment teams onto DeFi (MIP68)   [MIP65] Clydesdale - Liquid Bond Strategy & Execution   MIP65 onboards a RWA vault that will acquire USDC via the PSM and invest them in approved bond strategies. This MIP, importantly, also set out strict conditions for the setup of the underlying legal and governance structure and verification requirements.   [MIP68] Lusitano   MIP68 onboards a RWA Vault backed by the assets of a trust arranged by Monetalis. It brings about a RWA structure that can onboard a specific Green Economy SME lending strategy in the UK, but designed to be flexible enough to start as platform for Arranging and executing other lending collateral strategies efficiently.   When Time in your local-timezone format: 2022-05-10T17:00:00Z  Mark it on your Google Calendar!   Where  Crowdcast Call   Attn: @Recognized-Delegates, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @Real-World-Finance @SES-Core-Unit, @Protocol-Engineering, @Growth-Core-Unit, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @gov-comms-core-unit, @collateral-core-unit, @dux-core-unit, @data-insights-cu, @immunefi-core-unit, @strat-fin-core-unit

Collateral Onboarding Call - Episode #42  May 10th, 2022  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Retro  00:48: Monetalis with Allan Pedersen and Alessio Marinelli  52:12: Q&A and Discussion about Monetalis MIP65 & MIP68   Video https://youtu.be/Zm9_RYBv68g  Introduction  Retro  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Welcome the MakerDAO community to episode #42 of the Collateral Onboarding Call. I am Retro from the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling CU. I have the pleasure of being joined by Monetalis group today: Allan Pedersen and Alessio Marinelli. Monetalis has become a household name at the MakerDAO forums, being involved with the community since mid-2021. Today, they present the evolution of their strategy for onboarding RWAs to Maker. Discussions about collateral happen in the Forum.    Monetalis MIP65 & MIP68  Monetalis Evolution - Miscellaneous   Allan Pedersen & Alessio Marinelli  Presentation 00:48  Monetalis1627×931 99.9 KB   ...a quick step back1629×926 70.5 KB   Dr. Maker & MEGA1632×927 191 KB   First Step into TradFi: Simple Rule of Engagement1628×928 97.7 KB   How ?1630×931 134 KB   CLYDESDALE, ARENA, LUSITANO1630×928 153 KB   Immediate Maker Result Focus, but with Eye-on-the-Prize1632×928 262 KB   Market Growth to build in a leadership position upon1630×927 162 KB   Arena1630×930 138 KB   Initial Satisfying Solution ARENA.1v1 -> Forced Evolution vX1632×930 217 KB   CLYDESDALE1632×931 123 KB   Institution Eng., Community Decision, Execute/Monitor + C.I.1631×929 214 KB   First Deployment Considerations: Safety, Yield & Clean Money1631×930 181 KB   LUSITANO1629×933 112 KB   Our approach1629×924 192 KB   Security framework1631×928 171 KB   Market update1629×927 225 KB   ESG pipeline characteristics1629×926 232 KB   Questions1629×928 91.7 KB   Discussion 52:26 - Retro: What was one of the most important lessons that your team has learned over the past year about working with the DAO and how to incorporate the DAO into the strategy to ensure all teams can move as quickly as possible and have all the requirements checkboxes checked? 55:38 - Retro: If the community has any follow-up questions, what is the best way to get a hold of these gentlemen to continue the discussion?  Closing Comment  Retro  Outro 56:29  Thanks to Allan and Alessio for that detailed presentation. We are looking forward to the ongoing conversation in forums. Thanks to everyone.   Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.

The recording of this session is live on YouTube. Slides from the presentation can be found here. Follow up contact information for our guests are: Allan Pedersen @Allan_Pedersen [email protected] Alessio Marinelli @wrongcomma [email protected]
